Constructor Detail

CustomScoresAndValues

public CustomScoresAndValues(java.lang.String template)
constructor - creates a new scoring and values object based on the definitions from file, found through a template name

Parameters:
template - the string that lets the class know which files to load - config/template.cf and config/template/[winpatterns|limithands|filepoints|fullmultipliers|individualmultipliers].txt

public int checkLimitHand(int[][] tiles,
                          int windoftheround,
                          int playerwind)
checks if a player has a limit hand

Parameters:
tiles - the tile arrangement in this hand
windoftheround - wind of the round
playerwind - player's wind
Returns:
limitpoints if the tiles compose a limit hand, otherwise 0

                         int tilepoints,

score computation basedon tilepoints and multipliers

Parameters:

tilepoints - number of basic tilepoints
multipliers - the number of multipliers
Returns:

calculateScores

public int[] calculateScores(int[] tilepoints,
                             int winner,
                             int east)
Determines the final score, given all scored tile points

Parameters:
tilepoints - int[] array with player 1-4's tile points
winner - the number of the player who won
east - the player number who played east this hand
Returns:
an int[] array with the resolved scores

simpleScoring

private int[] simpleScoring(int[] tilepoints,
                            int winner,
                            int east)
under simple scoring rules, the winner gets the number of points he or she made, and no one actually loses points. at the end of the game, the person with the most points just wins. the starting score for this type of scoring would typically be 0.

Parameters:
tilepoints - the int[] of scores made by each player
winner - the index position for which score in tilepoints belongs to the round winner
east - the index position for which score in the tilepoints belongs to the player playing east
Returns:
a "settled score" int[] array

payedScoring

private int[] payedScoring(int[] tilepoints,
                           int winner,
                           int east)
under payed scoring rules, the losers pay the winner the number of points he or she won with. the losers do not settle their individual differences.

Parameters:
tilepoints - the int[] of scores made by each player
winner - the index position for which score in tilepoints belongs to the round winner
east - the index position for which score in the tilepoints belongs to the player playing east
Returns:
a "settled score" int[] array

arithmeticScoring

private int[] arithmeticScoring(int[] tilepoints,
                                int winner,
                                int east)
under arithmetic scoring rules, the losers pay the winner the number of tilepoints he or she won with, and the losers pay each other the difference of their points too.

Parameters:
tilepoints - the int[] of scores made by each player
winner - the index position for which score in tilepoints belongs to the round winner
east - the index position for which score in the tilepoints belongs to the player playing east
Returns:
a "settled score" int[] array

loadDFSAs

private DynamicFSA[] loadDFSAs(java.lang.String filename)
loads all the DynamicFSA objects from a file

Parameters:
filename - the file containing dFSA definitions
Returns:
an array of DynamicFSA objects, one for each
